intro: Oncostemum ricnanense, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Oncostemum ricnanense is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
